entry.title: Nigeria: Plans to rehabilitate former Boko Haram faces opposition

media:group.media:title: Nigeria: Plans to rehabilitate former Boko Haram faces opposition
media:group.media:description:
The surrender of hundreds of Boko Haram fighters in Nigeria’s northeast is causing anxiety in Borno state. The government says it will rehabilitate and reintegrate the former fighters into society. But the plan has divided people who have suffered unimaginable atrocities during the 12-year conflict. In the last two months, about 6,000 fighters and their families surrendered due to renewed ground and aerial offensive by Nigerian troops. Hundreds of thousands have already been returned to their towns and villages to homes being rebuilt by the government. For now, officials seem determined to speed up the process of rebuilding trust - hoping it could break Boko Haram’s fighting spirit and bring lasting peace.
Al Jazeera’s Ahmed Idris reports from Maiduguri, Nigeria.

entry.title: Several killed in blast outside Kabul mosque

media:group.media:title: Several killed in blast outside Kabul mosque
media:group.media:description:
A bomb targeted the entrance of a mosque in the Afghan capital on Sunday leaving a “number of civilians dead,” a Taliban spokesman said. The bomb targeted the Eidgah Mosque in Kabul, where a memorial service was being held for the mother of Taliban spokesman Zabihullah Mujahid. Though no group has claimed responsibility for the attack, the Islamic State in Khorasan Province, ISKP (ISIS-K) - an affiliate of ISIL (ISIS) - is suspected behind it.
Al Jazeera’s Osama Bin Javaid joins us live from Kabul with the latest updates.

entry.title: Tens of thousands of Brazilians call for Bolsonaro’s impeachment

media:group.media:title: Tens of thousands of Brazilians call for Bolsonaro’s impeachment
media:group.media:description:
Tens of thousands of people have rallied in cities across Brazil, calling for the impeachment of President Jair Bolsonaro.
They accuse him of mishandling the COVID-19 pandemic, which has killed nearly 600,000 Brazilians.
#Brazil #Bolsonaro
And as Al Jazeera's Monica Yanakiew reports, many people are also angry with rising unemployment, poverty and inflation. - Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish/ - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera/ - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/

entry.title: Lebanon’s public water supply is at the brink of collapse

media:group.media:title: Lebanon’s public water supply is at the brink of collapse
media:group.media:description:
Lebanon's long-troubled public water system is being pushed closer to the brink of collapse.
Water has been in short supply for decades, with people forced to pay for private supplies, but the situation is now critical.
Aid agencies say taps could run dry for at least 70 percent of the population.
Al Jazeera's Sara Khairat reports from Beirut, Lebanon.
#Lebanon
- Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish/ - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera/ - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/

entry.title: China: Landmark case challenges fertility treatment limit

media:group.media:title: China: Landmark case challenges fertility treatment limit
media:group.media:description:
The Chinese government is trying to encourage people to have more children but unmarried women are currently denied access to reproductive services.
That could soon change, as a landmark court case is challenging the law that limits fertility treatment to married couples.
Al Jazeera's Katrina Yu reports from Beijing.
- Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish/ - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera/ - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/

entry.title: Chile protesters clash with police over asylum seekers

media:group.media:title: Chile protesters clash with police over asylum seekers
media:group.media:description:
Several people have been arrested and at least two injured in clashes between protesters demonstrating for and against asylum seekers in three cities across Chile.
Some rallied against the influx of refugees and others labelled the protestors xenophobic.
Al Jazeera's Lucia Newman reports from Santiago, Chile.
#Chile
- Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish/ - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera/ - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/

entry.title: Colombia: Flood of asylum seekers causes a housing crisis

media:group.media:title: Colombia: Flood of asylum seekers causes a housing crisis
media:group.media:description:
Locals in the Colombian town of Necocli say they are being pushed out of the housing market as landlords prefer to rent to Haitian asylum seekers able to pay in dollars.
The asylum seekers flooding in are trying to reach the United States.
Some 22,000 people are waiting for boats to take them to Panama where they can continue their journey.
#Colombia
- Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish/ - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera/ - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/

entry.title: Qataris cast ballots in first legislative elections

media:group.media:title: Qataris cast ballots in first legislative elections
media:group.media:description:
Votes are being counted in Qatar's first legislative elections. People have been choosing members for the "Shura Council". Voters will decide who fills 30 of the council's 45 seats. Al Jazeera's Jamal ElShayyal reports from Doha.
#Qatar
- Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish/ - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera/ - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/

entry.title: Tens of thousands of women march for abortion rights in US

media:group.media:title: Tens of thousands of women march for abortion rights in US
media:group.media:description:
More than six hundred marches have taken place across the United States to defend women's reproductive rights. They're opposing tough new abortion laws, particularly in Texas, which has effectively banned the procedure after around six weeks of pregnancy. Protesters say they fear the law is a slippery slope for the rest of the country. Al Jazeera's Heidi Zhou-Castro reports from one of the rallies, in the city of Austin in Texas.
#Abortion #Texas #US
- Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish/ - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera/ - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/

entry.title: How will the Taliban handle its dispute with Tajikistan? | Inside Story

media:group.media:title: How will the Taliban handle its dispute with Tajikistan? | Inside Story
media:group.media:description:
Tension is rising between Afghanistan and Tajikstan. Last week, the Taliban warned the Tajik government against meddling in Afghanistan's internal affairs. It comes after Tajik President Emomali Rahmon refused to recognise the new Taliban government and accused the group of human rights abuses against a Tajik minority in the Panjshir Valley. Panjshir fell for the first time to the Taliban last month, after fierce battles. So, is a possible war looming along the Afghan-Tajik border? And what's the fallout for Central Asia?
Presenter: Sami Zeidan
Guests:
Faiz Zaland - Professor of Political Science at Kabul University.
Parviz Mullojonov - Tajikistan Plitical Analyst.
Vladimir Sotnikov - International Affairs Specialist at the Russian Academy of Sciences.

entry.title: Taliban foreign affairs spokesman denounced US drone operations | al Jazeera Exclusive

media:group.media:title: Taliban foreign affairs spokesman denounced US drone operations | al Jazeera Exclusive
media:group.media:description:
Taliban spokesman Abdul Qahar Balkhi told Al Jazeera that US violating its commitments by flying drones across Afghan airspace. Taliban said that it is speaking directly with the US to build better relations.

entry.title: Lengthy coalition talks hamper European governments

media:group.media:title: Lengthy coalition talks hamper European governments
media:group.media:description:
It has been six months since the Netherlands held elections - yet coalition talks are still under way. After Sunday's election result in Germany, many fear it may be going down the same path. Al Jazeera's Step Vaessen reports from The Hague, Netherlands.
- Subscribe to our channel: http://aje.io/AJSubscribe - Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/
#AlJazeeraEnglish #Netherlands #CoalitionTalks

entry.title: UK government clears army to begin petrol deliveries from Monday

media:group.media:title: UK government clears army to begin petrol deliveries from Monday
media:group.media:description:
Almost 200 British army personnel will be called up from Monday to deliver fuel to petrol stations. The United Kingdom is in the grip of fuel shortages, with a lack of tanker drivers provoking panic buying. The government has tried to entice foreign drivers with special visas, but as Al Jazeera's Neave Barker reports, the deal may not be tempting enough.
- Subscribe to our channel: http://aje.io/AJSubscribe - Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/
#AlJazeeraEnglish #UnitedKingdom

entry.title: COVID-19 state of emergency lifted in Chile as cases decline

media:group.media:title: COVID-19 state of emergency lifted in Chile as cases decline
media:group.media:description:
A cause for celebration in Chile, a state of emergency imposed to stop the spread of COVID-19 has finally been lifted. Strict night-time curfews had been in place since early 2020. But after a recent decline in infections, life is returning to normal for many. Al Jazeera's Lucia Newman reports from Santiago, Chile.

entry.title: Colombians say town of Necocli ‘overwhelmed’ with migrants

media:group.media:title: Colombians say town of Necocli ‘overwhelmed’ with migrants
media:group.media:description:
People living in a small Colombian town say an influx of mostly Haitian refugees and migrants is pushing them out of housing. The migrants are trying to catch boats on their way north to the United States. Al Jazeera's Alessandro Rampietti reports from the town of Neclocli, Colombia.
